If you enjoyed Alundra and want to play another, I agree, do not play Alundra 2 .
Landstalker for genesis would be a good choice, the game that this one is based on more or less.

snippet.textDisplay:
@YinYang19 
Take my advice.. Avoid Alundra 2 like the damn and bloody pox that it is.
The gameplay wasn't up to snuff,
The story couldn't keep it rolling (predictably dull)
Even the music couldn't match up to its predecessor.

I can't believe I even sat through days of trying to beat it *eyetwitch*

Alundra all the way baby.

snippet.textDisplay: @Sinspiration Well I'm just saying that kind of thing does happen, but I understand at least there are similar characters and/or reference points/constants with the other franchises (even if that constant is everything being different like FF). As I mentioned companies are sometimes dirty dogs who go Q:"how can we make money off a piece of shit??" A:"....We'll sell that piece of shit with a label that reads 'GOLD' so ppl will buy it". It was indeed blunt and they didnt think it out too well.
snippet.textOriginal: @Sinspiration Well I'm just saying that kind of thing does happen, but I understand at least there are similar characters and/or reference points/constants with the other franchises (even if that constant is everything being different like FF). As I mentioned companies are sometimes dirty dogs who go Q:"how can we make money off a piece of shit??" A:"....We'll sell that piece of shit with a label that reads 'GOLD' so ppl will buy it". It was indeed blunt and they didnt think it out too well.

snippet.textDisplay: @Sinspiration Agreed. But they obviously partly did that for Alundra 2 to be recognised and to sell more copies. Companies do this all the time. Alot of people debate about whether the recent final fantasies, castlevanias and zelda games are true to their previous iterations... This goes all the way back to NES Zelda II syndrome

snippet.textDisplay: Make NO mistake: One of the greatest (and among the most underrated) games of all time. Better than a lot of Zeldas. As far as Zelda goes, only Ocarina of Time and A Link to the Past can stand up to Alundra. AND it comes out on PSN Tuesday! Can you say instant purchase much?!
snippet.textOriginal: Make NO mistake: One of the greatest (and among the most underrated) games of all time. Better than a lot of Zeldas. As far as Zelda goes, only Ocarina of Time and A Link to the Past can stand up to Alundra. AND it comes out on PSN Tuesday! Can you say instant purchase much?!

snippet.textDisplay: Nah, sry fella but that's your Opinion. Zelda ALTTP alone crushes this game, no,, series. Call me a 'fanboy' but there's no comparison just because it may tug at people's JRPG heartstrings. Skyward Sword is one of the supposedly 'weaker' Zelda games and I prefer it infinitely more to this; I remember returning this to Blockbusters all those 20 years ago! Just because it's nostalgic, doesn't mean it's good

snippet.textDisplay:
I might love Zelda, but Alundra is obviously much much better. It is reaally immersing, with an incredible story, and a huge array of characters, each with their own personality that will make you either love them or hate them with a passion.

For those who haven't played Alundra, but like adventure/rpg games, I recommend this game. The puzzles will make you want to punch puppy fetuses, but I can't think of a game that's better than this.
snippet.textOriginal:
I might love Zelda, but Alundra is obviously much much better. It is reaally immersing, with an incredible story, and a huge array of characters, each with their own personality that will make you either love them or hate them with a passion.

For those who haven't played Alundra, but like adventure/rpg games, I recommend this game. The puzzles will make you want to punch puppy fetuses, but I can't think of a game that's better than this.

snippet.textDisplay: Extremely awesome game, very very involving. Some of the puzzles (the dream where you have to move Ice-pillars around, for example) stunned me when I was younger. It's also very beautiful. 10/10!

I have to agree with you strangely enough, Alundra had this weird weird feeling that the game was much better.

That or because that the storyline of Alundra was more active and all... or something

Anyway, fanboys will hit me for this, but I think Alundra is better than Zelda. (Though Alundra 2 sucked very very much)

snippet.textDisplay:
One of my favorite tracks from the game.  Was always curious to see what'd be like if the "outside" tracks of Alundra and Final Fantasy VII had switched places, or even Ocarina of Time's.  This one seems to provide a unique medium between those two.

Great great add, SupraDarky.
snippet.textOriginal:
One of my favorite tracks from the game.  Was always curious to see what'd be like if the "outside" tracks of Alundra and Final Fantasy VII had switched places, or even Ocarina of Time's.  This one seems to provide a unique medium between those two.
